Investment Management

This module will explore and analyse the theory, concepts, tools and techniques of investment and portfolio management. The course builds upon and extends the concepts and techniques studied in the introduction to finance and corporate finance modules. At the conclusion of the course the student should be familiar with current industry practice and an understanding of the theoretical framework supporting investment analysis and portfolio management.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics of financial assets and the investment environment including industry ethics.

+  Discuss the main concepts of modern portfolio and capital market theory and their link to asset pricing models.

+  Demonstrate an understanding of equilibrium asset pricing models and factor models.

+  Generate common financial statements and reports from complete and incomplete accounting data.

+  Demonstrate an understanding of investment analysis, including a competence in the use of various equity and bond valuation models.
